meanings.definition: A traditional Polynesian garment worn wrapped around the waist.
meanings.sent1: She wore a colorful lavalava to the luau.
meanings.sent2: The dancer's lavalava swayed gracefully as she moved.
meanings.sent3: The lavalava looked like a vibrant rainbow around his waist.
meanings.sent4: Her lavalava was a burst of colors in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The soft fabric of the lavalava fluttered in the breeze.

meanings.definition: To wrap or tie a lavalava around the body.
meanings.sent1: He learned how to lavalava properly from his grandmother.
meanings.sent2: She lavalavaed the cloth securely around her waist.
meanings.sent3: They decided to lavalava each other as a fun game.
meanings.sent4: The vines lavalavaed the tree trunk like a natural embrace.
meanings.sent5: The magician lavalavaed the scarf around his arm magically.
